medical_history.chief_complaint: Diarrhea, suprapubic pain, and vomiting associated with eating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced diarrhea that initially improved with a BRAT diet but worsened three days prior to admission after liberalizing her diet. She noted having loose stools per day, with food consistently triggering emesis. The suprapubic pain was described as non-radiating and colicky, improving with defecation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: End stage renal disease (ESRD) secondary to diabetes mellitus type 2, diabetic nephropathy of the graft, post-transplant CMV infection, hypertension, coronary artery disease with NSTEMI, duodenal fistula, and previous cholecystectomy for gallstone ileus.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of non-insulin dependent diabetes mellitus (NIDDM) and congestive heart failure (CHF), mother died of myocardial infarction (MI) with onset of diabetes mellitus (IDDM), brother died of CHF and NIDDM, sister alive.
